server.universe
Class Universe

java.lang.Object
  server.universe.Universe
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultUniverse
public class Universe
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

A Universe represents the entire state of the virtual world. A universe contains Rooms and Entities. Universe is a singleton class -- there is no public constructor; instances are gotten with getInstance(). The Universe keeps track of all the creatures and their locations, including the players, and whether the players are logged in or not.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

Universe

public Universe()
0-arg constructor. Be careful when using this as it sets startRoom to null. setStartRoom must be used if this is used.

Universe

public Universe(Room startRoom)
In this constructor, a simple default universe might be made.

changeRoomOfCreature

public void changeRoomOfCreature(Creature creature,
                                 Room room)
Change current location of a creature. This doesn't check whether the new room is adjacent or anything, it just does it.

getLoggedInPlayers

isRegistered

public boolean isRegistered(java.lang.String name)
Check whether a player name is registered.

register

public void register(java.lang.String name)
Register a player with this name. Put the player in the starting room. But, do not log them in yet.

Parameters:
name - name of the player

unregister

public void unregister(java.lang.String name)
Remove a player from the list of registered players. If the player with the given name is in the game right now, boot them.

Parameters:
name - name of the player

login

public void login(Player player)
Adds a player to the list of logged-in players in the Universe. Tell the server that a user is now logged in. The Universe can now find a rightful place for the user. If the Player was not previously in the list of players on the server, it will now be added and put into the starting room.

Parameters:
player - to add

spawnMob

public void spawnMob(MOB mob,
                     Room room)
Spawns a mob in the given room.

logout

public void logout(Player player)
Removes a player from the list of currently logged-in players. This removes the player from the world, but it doesn't lose track of the player's location. It does not delete a Player from the list of Players in the Universe.

Parameters:
player - to remove

sendMessageToCreature

public void sendMessageToCreature(Creature sender,
                                  Creature receiver,
                                  ClientMessage message)
Send a message to one creature.

sendMessageToCreaturesInRoom

public void sendMessageToCreaturesInRoom(Creature sender,
                                         Room room,
                                         ClientMessage textSaid)
Send a message to all creatures in a room. For players, this means sending some text to a client. For mobs, these means calling a method to notify the mob that it has been sent certain text.
